definition: to discuss two disparate things together (idiom); to mention on equal terms/to place on a par with/(often with negatives: impossible to mention X in the same breath as Y)
each other/one another/mutually/fret on the neck of a pipa 琵琶[pi2 pa5] (a fret on the soundboard is called a 品[pin3])
surname Xiang
appearance/portrait/picture/government minister/(physics) phase/(literary) to appraise (esp. by scrutinizing physical features)/to read sb's fortune (by physiognomy, palmistry etc)
to carry (hanging down from the hand)/to lift/to put forward/to mention/to raise (an issue)/upwards character stroke/lifting brush stroke (in painting)/scoop for measuring liquid
and/furthermore/also/together with/(not) at all/simultaneously/to combine/to join/to merge
to combine/to amalgamate
variant of 並|并[bing4]
abbr. for 論語|论语[Lun2 yu3], The Analects (of Confucius)
opinion/view/theory/doctrine/to discuss/to talk about/to regard/to consider/per/by the (kilometer, hour etc)

sentences.english: Actually no one can parallel him in writing.
sentences.chinese: 事实上没人能在写作上和他相提并论。

sentences.english: It is true that abdicating the throne is by no means the most easy thing as failure of examination.
sentences.chinese: 当然没有通过考试是不能和总统辞职相提并论。

sentences.english: Don't bracket me with him just because we work for the same company.
sentences.chinese: 别因为我和他在一家公司工作而把我们相提并论。

sentences.english: There is nothing in China to match the Venezuelan orchestral revolution.
sentences.chinese: 中国也没法和委内瑞拉革命相提并论。

sentences.english: It has a degree of openness and precision that is only matched by the best solid-core cables.
sentences.chinese: 此线材丰富宽广及精确，只有好的线材才能相提并论。

sentences.english: He has also equated cyberthreats with nuclear and biological weapons.
sentences.chinese: 他还把网络威胁与核武器和生化武器相提并论。

sentences.english: The vases of the ancient Greeks cannot rival them in workmanship .
sentences.chinese: 古希蜡的花瓶在制作工艺上也无法与它相提并论。

sentences.english: It’s much, much better than Internet Explorer, and on-par with Firefox.
sentences.chinese: 它远优于IE浏览器，并与FIREFOX相提并论。

sentences.english: You cannot equate his poems with his plays.
sentences.chinese: 你不可以把他的诗歌和他的剧本相提并论。

sentences.english: Gog of Magog has a plan to destroy Israel but is no match for the power of God.
sentences.chinese: 哥格计划毁灭以色列，但跟天主的力量不能相提并论。

sentences.english: For no creatures under God are as we are, none so like Him as ourselves.
sentences.chinese: 只有我们能和上帝相提并论，别无分号。

sentences.english: Most English people bracket American and Canadian accents together.
sentences.chinese: 大多数英国人都把美国音和加拿大音相提并论。

sentences.english: It can be compared with classmates and comrades-in-arms is the fellow townsman .
sentences.chinese: 可以与同学和战友相提并论的是同乡。

sentences.english: people equate success in life with the ability of operating computer.
sentences.chinese: 人们把会施用计较机与人生乐成相提并论。

sentences.english: People equate success in life with the ability of  operating computer.
sentences.chinese: 人们把会使用计算机与人生成功相提并论。

sentences.english: People equate success in life with the ability of operating computer.
sentences.chinese: 人们把会使用秏羗计算机与人生成功相提并论。

definition: to match/is comparable with
to compare/to draw a parallel/to match/analogy/metaphor/comparison
contend against
to be equal to/to be well-matched/rival
lit. to speak of two things on the same day (idiom); to mention things on equal terms (often with negatives: you can't mention X at the same time as Y)
to be on an equal footing
to be shoulder to shoulder/to be on an equal level with/Taiwan pr. [bi4 jian1]
to run neck and neck/to keep pace with/to keep abreast of/on a par with one another
to hope to reach/to strive for
equally matched/about the same
equally famous
peer competition/to function as rivals/to make claims as an equal
inferior (often in the combination 毫無遜色|毫无逊色, not in the least inferior)
lit. mustn't speak of two things on the same day (idiom); not to be mentioned in the same breath/incomparable
pinyin: bu4 ke3 tong2 ri4 er2 yu3

definition: second after/second only to
contemporary
